seo.title_override: San Diego Mattress Disposal & Recycling Guide 2026
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigate San Diego mattress disposal rules and avoid a $1,000 fine. Learn about recycling options and check city guidelines for curbside pickup.

hero_hook: Disposing of an old mattress in San Diego can be a costly headache if not done right.
neighborhoods: Pacific Beach, La Jolla, North Park, South Park, Hillcrest, Little Italy, Gaslamp Quarter, Mission Beach, Ocean Beach, Point Loma, Old Town, Mira Mesa, Carmel Valley, Rancho Bernardo, University City

drop_off_locations.name: The Mattress Collection Site
drop_off_locations.hours: Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. The site is closed on Saturdays and Sundays.
drop_off_locations.tipping_fee: Free for mattresses and box springs. Landfill fees may apply if your mattresses are brought in with other waste.
drop_off_locations.notes: Accepts mattresses, box springs, and futon mattresses (must be removed from frame or base). Items must not be severely damaged, wet, twisted, frozen, soiled or infested with bedbugs. No drop-off limit. The site is CLOSED on the following holidays: New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. Does not accept mattress pads or toppers, sleeping bags and cots, pillows, cushions, blankets, sheets and other loose bedding, car beds, infant carriers, lounge pads or crib bumpers, juvenile products (carriages, baskets, cribs, crib mattresses, bassinets, dressing tables, dressing table pads, strollers and playpens, crib bumpers or their pads), waterbeds, collapsible rollaway beds, camping air mattresses, foldout sofa beds, futon frames/bases, or household furniture. Mattresses or box springs in a cardboard box or plastic bag are not accepted.

competitor_comparison.value_prop: No franchise fees. Just local haulers.
